explanation: Agent A is correct. The supplied macro definition shows use of GCC-style __attribute__((always_inline)), which is a documented compiler extension. MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 prohibits use of language/compiler extensions (unless documented/allowed by the project), so the presence of __attribute__ in the macro expansion is a violation. (To comply, the code should avoid GCC-specific attributes or guard them so they are not used when the compiler does not document them as extensions.)
